title: The Living camera, with Paul
creator_credit: D.A. Pennebaker, R. Leacock, Greg Shuker, Robert Drew, Drew Associates and Time-Life Broadcast
brief_description: Can a murderer become rehabilitated while he sits in death row for nine years awaiting electrocution? If he can, should his sentence be commuted to life? A young Chicago attorney answers “yes” to both questions. He then undergoes the agony and elation of a successful plea to the parole board with famed Louis Nizer at his side. Filmed with hand-held camera and sound recorder.
